unit_learning_outcomes.description: Use critical thinking skills to evaluate a range of academic and public issues including; socio-cultural, personal and interpersonal concepts.
Apply knowledge in basic sciences to demonstrate understanding of key concepts in the areas of biology, chemistry and physics.
Interpret and analyse a variety of scientific data including; text, graphs, tables and diagrams.
Interpret and analyse a variety of media from social and political contexts and synthesise persuasive and reflective commentary.
Apply problem solving and critical thinking skills in the basic sciences.
Organise and express ideas in a logical and effective way under examination conditions.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Each week students will complete an essay and engage in online peer discussion regarding their essay.

assessments.description: A simulated mock medical school interview.

A full-length mock medical school admission test aimed at helping students identfiy areas that require improvement and enabling students to reflect on their approach to studying for future medical school admissions tests.

assessments.assessment_title: Condensed Mock Medical Schools Admission Test
assessments.description: A shortened mock medical schools admission test.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit aims to prepare students for medical school admission processes. It addresses key concepts covered within graduate medical schools admission test: social sciences (humanities), written communication (essay writing) and sciences (biology, chemistry, and physics). This unit aims to further develop your critical thinking, judgement, reasoning and communication skills that are assessed as part of graduate medical school admission processes.
data.title: Medical Admissions Preparation

description: This unit aims to prepare students for medical school admission processes. title: Medical Admissions Preparation
